00004   struct Lambda
00005   {
00006     string name;
00007     string ret_type;
00008     unsigned long nargs;
00009     map<string,string> arguments;
00010     bool fastcc;
00011     bool tco;
00012     bool lining;
00013     string docstring;
00014   };
00015   
00016   struct MetaFunction
00017   {
00018     vector<Lambda> versions;
00019   };
00020   
00021   map<string,MetaFunction> FunctionTable;
00022   
00023   /*
00024    * - Iterate over the arguments, noting type-annotated and polymorphic arguments
00025    * - Iterate over the code, storing all expressions in a list 'precode'
00026    * - Find a typecase, ensure there is no code after it
00027    * - Ensure the first argument to typecase is an argument declared as being polymorphic
00028    * - Iterate over every branch of the typecase, ensuring the first element of each list is a valid type name
00029    *  - Call defineFunction with the same function name, where the code is the precode plus the rest of the code in this branch (This should recursively apply nested typecases).*/
00030   
00031   string fn_code;
00032   
00033   void print(map<string,string> in)
00034   {
00035     printf("{\n");
00036     for(map<string,string>::iterator i = in.begin(); i != in.end(); i++)
00037     {
00038       printf("\t%s : %s\n", i->first.c_str(), i->second.c_str());
00039     }
00040     printf("}\n");
00041   }
00042   
00043   void print_metafunction(string in)
00044   {
00045     for(unsigned int i = 0; i < FunctionTable[in].versions.size(); i++)
00046     {
00047       printf("\t\t{\n");
00048       printf("\t\t\t Return type: %s\n",FunctionTable[in].versions[i].ret_type.c_str());
00049       printf("\t\t\t Number of Arguments: %lu\n",FunctionTable[in].versions[i].nargs);
00050       printf("\t\t\t Tail Call Optimized?: %s\n",FunctionTable[in].versions[i].tco ? "Yes" : "No");
00051       printf("\t\t}\n");
00052     }
00053   }
00054   
00055   void print_fntable()
00056   {
00057     printf("{\n");
00058     for(map<string,MetaFunction>::iterator i = FunctionTable.begin(); i != FunctionTable.end(); i++)
00059     {
00060       printf("\t%s: \n",i->first.c_str());
00061       print_metafunction(i->first);
00062     }
00063     printf("}\n");
00064   }
00065   
00066   enum fnType {Function, Fast, Recursive};
00067   
00068   #define args (nth(form,args_pos))
00069   
00070   const unsigned int name_pos = 1;
00071   const unsigned int ret_type_pos = 2;
00072   const unsigned int args_pos = 3;
00073   const unsigned int docstring_pos = 4;
00074   
00075   void validate_function(Form* form)
00076   {
00077     if(length(form) < 2)
00078       error("Can't define a function with no name.",at(form));
00079     else if(length(form) < 3)
00080       error("Can't define a function with no return type.",at(form));
00081     else if(length(form) < 4)
00082       error("Can't define a function with no argument list.",at(form));
00083     if(length(form) < 5)
00084       error("Can't define a function with no body (The block of code to execute).",at(form));
00085     if(tag(nth(form,name_pos)) != Atom)
00086       error("Can't use a list as a function name.",at(form));
00087     else if(analyze(val(nth(form,name_pos))) != Symbol)
00088       error("Can't use a non-symbolic atom as a function name.",at(form));
00089     if(args != NULL)
00090       if(tag(args) != List)
00091         error("The argument list must be a list.",at(form));
00092   }

00100   string polymorphicExpansion(Form* form, unsigned int pos)
00101   {
00102     map<string,unsigned long> arguments;
00103     unsigned long nargs = length(args);
00104     unsigned int i;
00105     Form* current;
00106     if(nargs > 0)
00107     {
00108       for(i = 0; i < length(args); i++)
00109       {
00110         current = nth(args,i);
00111         if(islist(current))
00112         {
00113           if(isatom(car(current)))
00114           {
00115             if(val(car(current)) == "poly")
00116             {
00117               arguments[val(cdr(current))] = i;
00118             }             
00119           }
00120         }
00121       }
00122       for(;pos < length(form); pos++)
00123       {

00125         unsigned long argument_pos;

00135             {
00136               string type;
00137               if(length(current) < 3)
00138               {
00139                 printf("ERROR: A typecase form takes at least three arguments.");
00140                 Unwind();
00141               }
00142               if(islist(nth(current,1)))
00143               {
00144                 printf("ERROR: The first argument of a typecase must be the argument name");
00145                 Unwind();

00147               else
00148               {
00149                 type = val(nth(current,1));
00150                 map<string,unsigned long>::iterator seeker = arguments.find(type);

00152                 {
00153                   //Argument exists
00154                   argument_pos = seeker->second;
00155                   //Do the rest
00156                 }

00158                 {
00159                   printf("ERROR: A non-polymorphic or nonexistent argument was provided to a typecase form.");
00160                   Unwind();

00164               for(i = 2; i < length(current); i++)
00165               {

00168                   printf("ERROR: An atom was found in a typecase form.");

00181                     Unwind();
00182                   }

00185                     string replacement_type = print(car(nth(current,i)));
00186                     Form* replacement_code = cdr(nth(current,i));

00188                 }
00189               }
00190             }
00191           }
00192         }

00194     }
00195     else

00198   
00199   string defineFunction(Form* form, fnType fn_type, bool inlining)
00200   {
00201     //0                                                1      2          3             [3]         3/4 (Depending on the docstring)
00202     //(function|fast|recursive|inline|recursive-inline [name] [ret_type] (arg1, arg1, ..., argn) "docstring" [body]*
00203     const bool has_docstring = /*((tag(nth(form,docstring_pos)) == Atom) && (analyze(val(nth(form,docstring_pos))) == String))*/ false;
00204     const unsigned int body_starting_pos = (has_docstring ? 1+docstring_pos : docstring_pos); 
00205     validate_function(form);
00206     Lambda newfn;
00207     if(fn_type == Function) { newfn.fastcc = false; newfn.tco = false; newfn.lining = inlining; }
00208     else if(fn_type == Fast) { newfn.fastcc = true; newfn.tco = false; newfn.lining = inlining; }
00209     else if(fn_type == Recursive) { newfn.fastcc = true; newfn.tco = true; newfn.lining = inlining; }
00210     string fn_name = val(nth(form,name_pos));
00211     string fn_ret_type = printTypeSignature(nth(form,ret_type_pos));
00212     newfn.ret_type = fn_ret_type;
00213     /*map<string,Lambda>::iterator macfind = Macros.find(fn_name);
00214     if(macfind != Macros.end())
00215       { printf("ERROR: A macro has already been defined with that name."); Unwind(); }*/
00216     Scope new_scope;
00217     SymbolTable.push_back(new_scope);
00218     //Iterate over arguments
00219     map<string,string> fn_args;
00220     Form* current_arg;
00221     if(args != NULL)
00222     {
00223       for(long i = 0; i < length(args); i++)
00224       {
00225         current_arg = nth(args,i);
00226         //printf("\nAnalyzing:%s",print(current_arg).c_str());
00227         if(tag(current_arg) == List)
00228         {
00229           if(tag(nth(current_arg,0)) != Atom)
00230           {
00231             printf("ERROR: An argument name must be a symbol, not a list or any other kind of atom.");
00232             Unwind();
00233           }
00234           else
00235           {
00236             string argname = val(nth(current_arg,0));
00237             map<string,string>::iterator seeker = fn_args.find(argname);
00238             if(seeker != fn_args.end())
00239             {
00240               printf("ERROR: Argument name '%s' was already defined in this argument list:\n%s",
00241                      argname.c_str(),print(nth(form,2)).c_str());
00242             }
00243             else
00244             {
00245               string type = printTypeSignature(nth(current_arg,1));
00246               fn_args[argname] = type;
00247               SymbolTable[ScopeDepth][argname].sym = type;
00248             }
00249           }
00250         }
00251         else
00252         { 
00253           //Handle Dynamic args
00254         }
00255       }
00256     }
00257     newfn.arguments = fn_args;
00258     newfn.nargs = ((unsigned)fn_args.size())/2;
00259     string tmp_code;
00260     map<string,MetaFunction>::iterator seeker = FunctionTable.find(fn_name);
00261     if(seeker != FunctionTable.end())
00262     {
00263       for(unsigned int i = 0; i < seeker->second.versions.size(); i++)
00264       {
00265         if(newfn.nargs == 0 && seeker->second.versions[i].nargs == 0)
00266         {
00267           printf("ERROR: A function with the same prototype has already been defined.");
00268           Unwind();
00269         }
00270         else if(fn_args == seeker->second.versions[i].arguments /*&& (fn_ret_type == seeker->second.versions[i].ret_type)*/) //Functions may not yet be differentiated by return type
00271         {
00272           printf("ERROR: A function with the same prototype has already been defined.");
00273           Unwind();
00274         }
00275       }
00276       seeker->second.versions.push_back(newfn);
00277       string arg_code;
00278       for(map<string,string>::iterator i = fn_args.begin(); i != fn_args.end(); i++)
00279       {
00280         arg_code += i->second + " %" + i->first+to_string(ScopeDepth) + ",";
00281       }
00282       tmp_code = (string)"define " + fn_ret_type + " @" + fn_name + to_string(seeker->second.versions.size()-1)
00283       + "(" + ((length(args) == 1) ? cutlast(cutlast(arg_code)) : cutlast(arg_code)) + "){\n";
00284     }
00285     else
00286     {
00287       MetaFunction new_metafn;
00288       new_metafn.versions.push_back(newfn);
00289       FunctionTable[fn_name] = new_metafn;
00290       string arg_code;
00291       //print(fn_args);
00292       for(map<string,string>::iterator i = fn_args.begin(); i != fn_args.end(); i++)
00293       {
00294         arg_code += i->second + " %" + i->first+to_string(ScopeDepth) + ", ";
00295       }
00296       tmp_code = (string)"define " + fn_ret_type + " @" + fn_name + "0" + "(" + ((length(args) == 1) ? cutlast(cutlast(arg_code)) : cutlast(arg_code))
00297       + "){\n";
00298     }
00299     //Compile the code
00300     for(unsigned long i = body_starting_pos; i < length(form);i++)
00301     {
00302       tmp_code += emitCode(nth(form,i));
00303     }
00304     fn_code = tmp_code + "ret " + fn_ret_type + " " + get_current_res() + "\n}";;
00305     return fn_code;
00306   }

00308   string callGeneric(long gen_pos, Form* code)

00310     printf("Not implemented yet.");
00311     Unwind();

00313   
00314   string callFunction(string func, Form* code)
00315   {
00316     if(analyze(func) != Symbol)
00317     {
00318       printf("ERROR: A non-symbolic atom was used as a function name.");
00319       Unwind();
00320     }
00321     else
00322     {
00323       for(unsigned long i = 0; i < Generics.size(); i++)
00324       {
00325         if(Generics[i].first == func)
00326         {
00327           if(Generics[i].second.id == typeFunction)
00328           {
00329             return callGeneric(i,code);
00330           }
00331         }
00332       }
00333       map<string,MetaFunction>::iterator seeker = FunctionTable.find(func);
00334       if(seeker != FunctionTable.end())
00335       {
00336         vector<string> arguments;
00337         vector<long long int> res_nums;
00338         string callcode;
00339         if(code != NULL)
00340         {
00341           Form* curr;
00342           for(long i = 0; i < length(code); i++)
00343           {
00344             curr = nth(code,i);
00345             callcode += emitCode(curr);
00346             arguments.push_back(res_type(get_current_res()));
00347             res_nums.push_back(res_version);
00348           }
00349         }
00350         for(unsigned int i = 0; i < seeker->second.versions.size(); i++)
00351         {
00352           if(seeker->second.versions[i].arguments.size() == arguments.size())
00353           {
00354             map<string,string>::iterator arg_iterator = seeker->second.versions[i].arguments.begin();
00355             for(unsigned int j = 0; j < arguments.size(); j++)
00356             {
00357               if(arguments[j] != arg_iterator->second)
00358               {
00359                 break;
00360               }
00361               //We don't have to check that the iterator is != arguments.end()
00362               //because that is done implicitly by the size() == arguments.size() check
00363               arg_iterator++;
00364             }
00365             //Found a matching function
00366             callcode += get_unique_res(seeker->second.versions[i].ret_type);
00367             callcode += (string)" = " + (seeker->second.versions[i].tco ? "tail call " : "call ");
00368             callcode += seeker->second.versions[i].fastcc ? "fastcc " : "ccc ";
00369             callcode += seeker->second.versions[i].ret_type + " @" + func + to_string(i) + (arguments.empty() ? "" :"(");
00370             for(arg_iterator = seeker->second.versions[i].arguments.begin();
00371                 arg_iterator != seeker->second.versions[i].arguments.end();
00372             arg_iterator++)
00373             {
00374               callcode += arg_iterator->second + " ";
00375               callcode += get_res(res_nums[0]) + ", ";
00376               res_nums.erase(res_nums.begin());
00377             }
00378             callcode = (arguments.empty() ? callcode : (cutlast(callcode) + ")"));
00379             return callcode;
00380           }
00381         }
00382       }
00383       else
00384       {
00385         printf("ERROR: Couldn't find the function '%s'.",func.c_str());
00386         Unwind();
00387       }        
00388     }
00389   }
